measured_by: Attribute-Amnesia paradigm / surprise memory test for an unexpected feature
justification: “An influential example is the attribute amnesia (AA) paradigm… On a surprise trial, participants are unexpectedly asked to report a second feature… Performance… at or close to chance level… suggests that the feature had been excluded from VWM.”

measured_by: VWM-driven attentional-bias paradigm / visual search task with feature-matching distractor singleton
justification: “The VWM-driven attentional bias paradigm exploits the finding that information held in VWM automatically biases attention toward matching sensory items… If responses… are slower when a distractor singleton matching the feature appears… this demonstrates that the feature is held in VWM.”

measured_by: Irrelevant-change distracting paradigm / orthogonal shape-change detection task
justification: “If the irrelevant feature is held in VWM, changes to it interfere with change-detection performance for the target feature. This irrelevant-change distracting effect has been replicated across… colour, shape, orientation…”
